node.title: New COVID-19 mandate rules millions of private workers must be vaccinated in New York City
node.alt: New York City mobile vaccination centre
node.description: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio imposes the United States's most-sweeping vaccine mandate, impacting around 3.7 million workers in the private sector.
node.content:
["From big Wall Street banks to corner grocery stores, all private employers in\u00a0New York City will have to require their workers to be\u00a0vaccinated against COVID-19.", "Mayor Bill de Blasio announced the broadest mandate the US\u00a0has seen and it comes\u00a0as COVID-19 cases across the country\u00a0rise again, with the Omicron variant beginning its spread.", "\"We in New York City have decided to use a pre-emptive strike, to really do something bold to stop the further growth of COVID and the dangers it's causing to all of us,\" Mr de Blasio\u00a0said.", "New York City's mandate\u00a0will take effect from December\u00a027, with workers needing to provide proof they have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine by that date.", "No-one will be allowed to get out of the requirement by agreeing to regular COVID-19 testing instead.", "However, religious or medical exemptions will be considered.", "The mayor also announced that anyone aged 12 years or older who wants to dine indoors at a restaurant, go to a gym or see a show will have to produce proof of having received two shots of the vaccine, up from the current requirement of one dose.", "In addition, children aged\u00a05 to 11 years would have to show proof of at least one shot, Mr de Blasio said.", "New York City boasts a population\u00a0of 8.8 million people, where 3.7 million make up the city's private-sector workforce.", "About 5.8 million New Yorkers of all ages are fully vaccinated, while 84 per cent of adults \u2014 5.9 million of 7 million people aged 18 years and older\u00a0\u2014 have received their first dose.", "According to a spokesperson for the mayor, roughly 184,000 businesses that were not covered by previous vaccine mandates will be impacted.", "Mr de Blasio said the move was aimed at staving off a spike of COVID-19 infections amid holiday gatherings and preventing its\u00a0spread\u00a0as cold weather drove\u00a0more people indoors.", "On average, New York City has just under 2,000 new COVID-19 cases daily, up from about 820 per\u00a0day at the start of November.", "\"Vaccination is the central weapon in this war against COVID,\" Mr de Blasio said at a virtual news conference.", "\"A lot of folks to me in the private sector have said to me they believe in vaccination, but they're not quite sure how they can do it themselves.", "\"Well, we're going to do it.\"", "Vaccinations are already required in New York City for hospital and aged care\u00a0workers and for city employees, including teachers, police officers and firefighters.", "
NYC\u00a0first to impose broad mandate
", "", "
New York City workers protest against COVID-19 vaccine mandate under President Joe Biden's administration which have been put on hold by federal judges.(AP: Jeenah Moon, File)
", "Vaccine rules across states and cities vary widely in the US, with some states resisting any mandates while others only require government employees or high-risk workers\u00a0to be vaccinated, such as those in health care.", "However, no state has announced a broad,\u00a0private-sector mandate like New York City's, according to\u00a0the nonpartisan National Academy for State Health Policy.", "US President Joe Biden had sought to impose a less-far-reaching mandate, where employees of businesses with 100 or more workers either would be\u00a0vaccinated or would undergo regular testing.", "However, federal courts have blocked that plan for now ahead of NYC's\u00a0January 4 deadline.", "Mr de Blasio said he expected\u00a0his mandate to survive any legal challenges.", "US health experts have strongly urged people to get their shots, and a booster, saying they believed the vaccine would\u00a0still offer protection against the new variant.", "AP/ABC"]
